English: Welcome to you all!
beginners' classroom
language discussion
new expressions, new rules
thank you, my friends
Let's begin!
so long, and Eywa be with you
My friends, ...

Na'vi: Tse... Nìawnomum, fwa oel fìtìkangkemvit sngeykivä'i krrnolekx nìtxan, slä nì'i'a tsun oe pivlltxe san Zola'u nìprrte' ne pìlok Na'viteri sìk!
Dictionary forms: tse:intj nìawnomum:adv fwa:ctr oe:pn tìkangkemvi:n sngä'i:v:in krrnekx:v:in nìtxan:adv slä:conj nì'i'a:adv tsun:v:m oe:pn plltxe:v:in san:part za'u:v:in nìprrte':adv ne:adp pìlok:n Na'viteri:n:pr sìk:part
English: Well... As you know, it took me a long time to start this project, but finally I am able to say: Welcome to the blog Na'viteri!
I really thank you for your patience.

Na'vi: Sìlpey oe, awngeyä lì'fyaolo'ìri fìpìlok lìyevu pxan, ulte frapo—ftxey sngä'iyu ftxey tsulfätu—tsìyevun fìtsenge rivun 'uot lesar.
Dictionary forms: sìlpey:v:in oe:pn awnga:pn lì'fyaolo':n pìlok:n lu:v:cp pxan:adj ulte:conj frapo:pn ftxey:conj sngä'iyu:n ftxey:conj tsulfätu:n tsun:v:m fìtsenge:adp run:v:tr 'u:n lesar:adj
English: I hope that this blog will be worthy of our language clan, and that everyone—whether beginner, whether expert—will be able to find something useful here.
The blog has three aims and three kinds of posts.
Firstly: beginners' classroom

Na'vi: Fayupxare layu aysngä'iyufpi, fte lì'fyari awngeyä fo tsìyevun nìftue nìltsansì nivume.
Dictionary forms: upxare:n lu:v:cp sngä'iyu:n fte:conj lì'fya:n awnga:pn po:pn tsun:v:m nìftue:adv nìltsan:adv nume:v:in
English: These messages will be aimed at beginners, so that they can learn our language easily and well.

Na'vi: Ma oeyä eylan, faysänumviri rutxe fì'ut tslivam.
Dictionary forms: ma:part oe:pn 'eylan:n sänumvi:n rutxe:intj fì'u:pn tslam:v:tr
English: My friends, please understand this about these lessons.

Na'vi: Nìltsan omum oel futa ayhapxìtul lì'fyaolo'ä awngeyä txantsana aysänumvit ngolop fte aylaru kivar.
Dictionary forms: nìltsan:adv omum:v:tr oe:pn fwa:ctr hapxìtu:n lì'fyaolo':n awnga:pn txantsan:adj sänumvi:n ngop:v:tr fte:conj lapo:pn kar:v:tr
English: I know well that the members of our language clan have created awesome lessons to teach others.

Na'vi: Faysulfätuä tìkangkem oheru meuia luyu nìngay.
English: I am truly honored by the work of these experts.

Na'vi: Kllkxayem fìtìkangkem oeyä rofa—ke io—pum feyä.
English: My work will stand next to—not above—theirs.
Secondly: language discussion

Na'vi: Fayupxaremì oe payängkxo teri horen lì'fyayä leNa'vi fpi sute a tsun srekrr tsat sivar.
English: In these messages I'll talk about the horen of the Na'vi language for people who can already use that.

Na'vi: Ayngeyä sìpawmìri kop fmayi fìtsenge tivìng sì'eyngit.
English: Also, I'll try to give answers to your questions here.

Na'vi: Nìawnomum tolel oel ta ayhapxìtu lì'fyaolo'ä pxaya sìpawmit atxantsan a vay set ke 'oleyng.
English: As you know, I received many great questions from the members of the language clan, that until now I haven't answered.

Na'vi: Sìlpey oe tsnì tsìyevun nì'i'a tsakem sivi fìpìlokfa.
English: I hope that by means of this blog I'll finally be able to do that.
Thirdly: new expressions, new rules
The aim of this part of the blog is clear.
Something else is clear, friends.

Na'vi: Krro krro fìtsenge oe tìkxey sayi. (Ke plltxe san sasyi sìk!)
Dictionary forms: krr:n krr:n fìtsenge:adv oe:pn tìkxey:n:si si:v:si ke:adv plltxe:v:in san:part si:v:si sìk:part
English: Sometimes I will make mistakes here. (I don't say I am planning to!)

Na'vi: Txo tsive'a ayngal keyeyt, rutxe oeru piveng fte tsivun oe sa'ut leykivatem.
Dictionary forms: txo:conj tse'a:v:tr nga:pn kxeyey:n rutxe:intj oe:pn peng:v:tr fte:conj tsun:v:m oe:pn tsa'u:pn latem:v:in
English: If you see mistakes, please tell me, so that I can correct them.

Na'vi: Ha awnga sngivä'i ko! Ziva'u nìmun ye'rìn... tsakrr rayun ayngal ayupxaret amip.
Dictionary forms: ha:adv awnga:pn sngä'i:v:in ko:part za'u:v:in nìmun:adv ye'rìn:adv tsakrr:adv run:v:tr nga:pn 'upxare:n mip:adj
English: So let us begin! Come again soon... then you will find new messages.
May Na'vi bloom.
from Paul
